page.title: 15WISTON CASTLE BY ELIZABETH.
page.content: The remains of Wiston castle consist of a motte or mound crowned by the ruins of a shell keep which was surrounded by a bailey.The motte'e height is 40 feet with a base circumference of 550 feet.The top is level and is 45-50 feet in diameter.Surrounding the motte is a moat or ditch 10 feet in depth.the bailey is in the form of an oblong guarded by a 3 foot moat.Its length from north to south is 450 feet and from east to west is 550.The house to the east of the bailey has taken the place of the fortified manor which succeeded the castle.
